org.mapdb

Class Pump

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mapdb.Pump

  • public class Pump
extends Object

    Data Pump moves data from one source to other. It can be used to import data from text file, or copy store from memory to disk.

      • sort

        public static <E> Iterator<E> sort(Iterator<E> source,
                   int batchSize,
                   Comparator comparator,
                   Serializer serializer)

        Sorts large data set by given Comparator. Data are sorted with in-memory cache and temporary files.

        Parameters:
        source - iterator over unsorted data
        batchSize - how much items can fit into heap memory
        comparator - used to sort data
        serializer - used to store data in temporary files
        E - type of data
        Returns:
        iterator over sorted data set

      • sort

        public static <E> Iterator<E> sort(Comparator comparator,
                   Iterator[] iterators)

        Merge presorted iterators into single sorted iterator.

        Parameters:
        comparator - used to compare data
        iterators - array of already sorted iterators
        E - type of data
        Returns:
        sorted iterator

      • buildTreeMap

        public static <K,V> void buildTreeMap(Iterator<K> source,
                      DB db,
                      String name,
                      Fun.Function1<V,K> valueExtractor)

        Build BTreeMap from presorted data. This method is much faster than usual import using Map.put(key,value) method. It is because tree integrity does not have to be maintained and tree can be created in linear way with.

        This method expect data to be presorted in reverse order (highest to lowest). There are technical reason for this requirement. To sort unordered data use sort(java.util.Iterator, int, java.util.Comparator, Serializer)

        This method does not call commit. You should disable Write Ahead Log when this method is used DBMaker.writeAheadLogDisable()

        Parameters:
        source - iterator over source data, must be reverse sorted
        db - database where Map will be created
        name - name of collection to create
        valueExtractor - transforms items from source iterator into values. If null BTreeMap will be constructed without values (as Set)
        K - Type of Map Keys
        V - Type of Map Values

      • buildTreeMap

        public static <K,V> void buildTreeMap(Iterator<K> source,
                      DB db,
                      String name,
                      Fun.Function1<V,K> valueExtractor,
                      int nodeSize,
                      boolean valuesStoredOutsideNodes,
                      boolean keepCounter,
                      BTreeKeySerializer<K> keySerializer,
                      Serializer<V> valueSerializer,
                      Comparator comparator)

        Build BTreeMap from presorted data. This method is much faster than usual import using Map.put(key,value) method. It is because tree integrity does not have to be maintained and tree can be created in linear way with.

        This method expect data to be presorted in reverse order (highest to lowest). There are technical reason for this requirement. To sort unordered data use sort(java.util.Iterator, int, java.util.Comparator, Serializer)

        This method does not call commit. You should disable Write Ahead Log when this method is used DBMaker.writeAheadLogDisable()

        Parameters:
        source - iterator over source data, must be reverse sorted
        db - database where Map will be created
        name - name of collection to create
        valueExtractor - transforms items from source iterator into values. If null BTreeMap will be constructed without values (as Set)
        nodeSize - maximal BTree node size before it is splited.
        valuesStoredOutsideNodes - if true values will not be stored as part of BTree nodes
        keepCounter - if true BTreeMap will keep track of number of its size, so Map.size() will not traverse all elements in map
        keySerializer - serializer for keys, use null for default value
        valueSerializer - serializer for value, use null for default value
        comparator - comparator used to compare keys, use null for ‘comparable comparator’
        K - Type of Map Keys
        V - Type of Map Values

      • buildTreeMap

        public static <K,V> void buildTreeMap(Iterator<Fun.Tuple2<K,V>> source,
                      DB db,
                      String name)

        Build BTreeMap from presorted data. This method is much faster than usual import using Map.put(key,value) method. It is because tree integrity does not have to be maintained and tree can be created in linear way with.

        This method expect data to be presorted in reverse order (highest to lowest). There are technical reason for this requirement. To sort unordered data use sort(java.util.Iterator, int, java.util.Comparator, Serializer)

        This method does not call commit. You should disable Write Ahead Log when this method is used DBMaker.writeAheadLogDisable()

        Parameters:
        source - iterator over source of data, must be reverse sorted
        db - database where Map will be created
        name - name of collection to create
        K - Type of Map Keys
        V - Type of Map Values

      • buildTreeMap

        public static <K,V> void buildTreeMap(Iterator<Fun.Tuple2<K,V>> source,
                      DB db,
                      String name,
                      int nodeSize,
                      boolean valuesStoredOutsideNodes,
                      boolean keepCounter,
                      BTreeKeySerializer<K> keySerializer,
                      Serializer<V> valueSerializer,
                      Comparator comparator)

        Build BTreeMap from presorted data. This method is much faster than usual import using Map.put(key,value) method. It is because tree integrity does not have to be maintained and tree can be created in linear way with.

        This method expect data to be presorted in reverse order (highest to lowest). There are technical reason for this requirement. To sort unordered data use sort(java.util.Iterator, int, java.util.Comparator, Serializer)

        This method does not call commit. You should disable Write Ahead Log when this method is used DBMaker.writeAheadLogDisable()

        Parameters:
        source - iterator over source of data, must be reverse sorted
        db - database where Map will be created
        name - name of collection to create
        nodeSize - maximal BTree node size before it is splited.
        valuesStoredOutsideNodes - if true values will not be stored as part of BTree nodes
        keepCounter - if true BTreeMap will keep track of number of its size, so Map.size() will not traverse all elements in map
        keySerializer - serializer for keys, use null for default value
        valueSerializer - serializer for value, use null for default value
        comparator - comparator used to compare keys, use null for ‘comparable comparator’
        K - Type of Map Keys
        V - Type of Map Values

      • buildTreeSet

        public static <E> void buildTreeSet(Iterator<E> source,
                    DB db,
                    String name)

        Build TreeSet from presorted data. This method is much faster than usual import using Set.add(entry) method. It is because tree integrity does not have to be maintained and tree can be created in linear way with.

        This method expect data to be presorted in reverse order (highest to lowest). There are technical reason for this requirement. To sort unordered data use sort(java.util.Iterator, int, java.util.Comparator, Serializer)

        This method does not call commit. You should disable Write Ahead Log when this method is used DBMaker.writeAheadLogDisable()

        Parameters:
        source - iterator over source of data, must be reverse sorted
        db - database where Map will be created
        name - name of collection to create
        E - type of elements held by a set

      • buildTreeSet

        public static <E> void buildTreeSet(Iterator<E> source,
                    DB db,
                    String name,
                    int nodeSize,
                    boolean keepCounter,
                    BTreeKeySerializer serializer,
                    Comparator comparator)

        Build TreeSet from presorted data. This method is much faster than usual import using Set.add(entry) method. It is because tree integrity does not have to be maintained and tree can be created in linear way with.

        This method expect data to be presorted in reverse order (highest to lowest). There are technical reason for this requirement. To sort unordered data use sort(java.util.Iterator, int, java.util.Comparator, Serializer)

        This method does not call commit. You should disable Write Ahead Log when this method is used DBMaker.writeAheadLogDisable()

        Parameters:
        source - iterator over source of data, must be reverse sorted
        db - database where Map will be created
        name - name of collection to create
        nodeSize - maximal BTree node size before it is splited.
        keepCounter - if true BTreeMap will keep track of number of its size, so Map.size() will not traverse all elements in map
        serializer - serializer for entries, use null for default value
        comparator - comparator used to compare keys, use null for ‘comparable comparator’
        E - type of elements held by a set

      • buildTreeMap

        public static <E,K,V> void buildTreeMap(Iterator<E> source,
                        DB db,
                        String name,
                        Fun.Function1<K,E> keyExtractor,
                        Fun.Function1<V,E> valueExtractor,
                        int nodeSize,
                        boolean valuesStoredOutsideNodes,
                        boolean keepCounter,
                        BTreeKeySerializer<K> keySerializer,
                        Serializer<V> valueSerializer,
                        Comparator comparator)

        Build BTreeMap (or TreeSet) from presorted data. This method is much faster than usual import using Map.put(key,value) method. It is because tree integrity does not have to be maintained and tree can be created in linear way with.

        This method expect data to be presorted in reverse order (highest to lowest). There are technical reason for this requirement. To sort unordered data use sort(java.util.Iterator, int, java.util.Comparator, Serializer)

        This method does not call commit. You should disable Write Ahead Log when this method is used DBMaker.writeAheadLogDisable()

        Parameters:
        source - iterator over source data, must be reverse sorted
        db - database where Map or Set will be created
        name - name of collection to create
        keyExtractor - transforms items from source iterator into keys. If null source items will be used directly as keys.
        valueExtractor - transforms items from source iterator into values. If null BTreeMap will be constructed without values (as Set)
        nodeSize - maximal BTree node size before it is splited.
        valuesStoredOutsideNodes - if true values will not be stored as part of BTree nodes
        keepCounter - if true BTreeMap will keep track of number of its size, so Map.size() will not traverse all elements in map
        keySerializer - serializer for keys, use null for default value
        valueSerializer - serializer for value, use null for default value
        comparator - comparator used to compare keys, use null for ‘comparable comparator’
        E - Type if items returned by source iterator
        K - Type of Map Keys
        V - Type of Map Values
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if source iterator is not reverse sorted
